str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: To renounce, disown, forbid, refuse. Reflexive past of a compound of apo and epo; to say off for oneself, i.e. Disown.
From krupto; concealed, i.e. Private.
Shame, shamefacedness, shameful deeds. From aischunomai; shame or disgrace.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Shrewdness, skill; hence: cunning, craftiness. From panougos; adroitness, i.e. trickery or sophistry.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To adulterate, corrupt, ensnare. From dolos; to ensnare, i.e. adulterate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A manifestation, disclosure. From phaneroo; exhibition, i.e. expression, a bestowment.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From alethes; truth.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To place together, commend, prove, exhibit; instrans: I stand with; To be composed of, cohere.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
